quizSrc.term: What is the significance of simulating the platform, interface, and interaction when creating a realistic digital prototype? | It increases the cost and time required for prototyping | It helps in marketing the product | It provides a realistic experience for user testing | It is a requirement for all digital prototypes
quizSrc.definition: It provides a realistic experience for user testing

quizSrc.term: Why is interactivity important for a digital prototype? | It makes the prototype more expensive to produce | It helps simulate the real user experience | It makes the prototype look more visually appealing | It allows developers to test their coding skills
quizSrc.definition: It helps simulate the real user experience

quizSrc.term: What does the term 'iterative' refer to in the context of prototyping in UX design? | Creating a design in one attempt without any revisions | Repeating a single step until it is perfect | Repeating the entire process to make improvements to the design | Designing multiple versions of the prototype at the same time
quizSrc.definition: Repeating the entire process to make improvements to the design

quizSrc.term: What factors should you consider when determining the number of screens needed for a digital prototype? | The complexity of the app | The number of different functions the app has | The color scheme of the app | The target audience of the app | The number of users the app is expected to have
quizSrc.definition: The complexity of the app | The number of different functions the app has

quizSrc.term: When developing a digital prototype, which of the following are true about creating pathways within the prototype? | Creating pathways provide a more realistic user experience | Pathways should be randomly created without considering user interaction | Pathways allow users to navigate through different screens | Pathways in a prototype are irrelevant to the user experience
quizSrc.definition: Creating pathways provide a more realistic user experience | Pathways allow users to navigate through different screens

quizSrc.term: Why is it important to test a digital prototype with users? | To find bugs in the code | To see if the app can handle multiple users at once | To get feedback on the user experience | To check if the app works on different devices
quizSrc.definition: To get feedback on the user experience

quizSrc.term: Which methods can be used to create a finished working simulation of a digital prototype? | Video playthroughs | Screen recording | 3D printing | Creating a physical mockup | Interactive versions
quizSrc.definition: Video playthroughs | Screen recording | Interactive versions

quizSrc.term: When creating a digital prototype, what is the purpose of designing fake fields for data entry? | To add visual complexity to the design | To confuse the users | To increase the loading time of the prototype | To simulate the user's interaction with the application
quizSrc.definition: To simulate the user's interaction with the application

quizSrc.term: As a UX designer, you're designing a new mobile app. Which of the following would be the most effective way to ensure the app's usability? | Design the app based on the latest design trends | Design the app based on your personal preferences | Design the app with a focus on incorporating as many features as possible | Test the app with a small group of users and iterate based on their feedback
quizSrc.definition: Test the app with a small group of users and iterate based on their feedback

quizSrc.term: Which of the following best describes the concept of 'usability' in UX design? | The use of cutting-edge technologies in a product | The aesthetic appeal of a product | The ease of use and learnability of a product | The marketing strategies used to promote a product
quizSrc.definition: The ease of use and learnability of a product

quizSrc.term: Select all the elements that are considered part of user experience (UX) design. | User research | Visual design | Website speed and responsiveness | Search Engine Optimization | Color theory
quizSrc.definition: User research | Visual design | Website speed and responsiveness | Color theory

quizSrc.term: In the context of UX Design, which of the following best describes the concept of 'Affordance'? | The visual cues that inform users about how an object can be used | The emotional response triggered by the design of a system | The ease with which users can navigate through a system | The cost associated with implementing a particular design feature
quizSrc.definition: The visual cues that inform users about how an object can be used

quizSrc.term: When evaluating prototyping software, which of the following should NOT be a key consideration? | The software's ability to simulate the platform, interface, and interaction | The frequency of bug fixes to the software | The software's compatibility with your preferred design tools | The cost of the software
quizSrc.definition: The frequency of bug fixes to the software
